verses.roman:
'duḥkha pāñā āsiyāche'--ei prabhura vākya śuni'
jānilā 'sarvajña prabhu'--eta anumāni'

synonyms: duḥkha—unhappiness; pāñā—getting; āsiyāche—he has come; ei—this; prabhura—of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; vākya—statement; śuni'-hearing; jānilā—could understand; sarvajña prabhu—the Lord is omniscient; eta—this; anumāni'-guessing.
translation: When Śrīkānta Sena heard the Lord say,"He is distressed," he could understand that the Lord is omniscient.
